questions.text: Do you think these new rules are hard or easy for restaurant owners to comply?
IF HARD Why do you say that?
IF EASY Why do you say that?
These rules are very complicated, making compliance difficult and costly for restaurant managers. Do you agree or disagree with that?
New York City's new restrictions will hurt the economy because smokers, who account for 25% of business, will eat out less or not stay for dessert or after dinner drinks.
New York City's new restrictions will hurt the economy because smokers, who account for 25% of business, will eat out of the city more.
Local smoking ordinances like the New York City rule are welcome. This was a problem that needed more regulation.
We already had rules that applied to the whole state, and new rules for various localities are a costly and unnecessary burden for small businesses in this state.
All sections of New York State should follow the state rules on smoking.
Given the large number of tourists that come to New York City and who like to smoke, it is important for our economy to allow smoking in restaurants.
